IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: LONG-TERM HEALTH CARE FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED
IRS990.MissionDesc: LONG-TERM HEALTH CARE FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED
IRS990.Desc: NURSING CARE AND SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED IN 12 SEPARATE RESIDENCES WITH A TOTAL OF 491 BEDS AND 40 INDEPENDENT LIVING UNITS. CARE IS PROVIDED ON A 24 HOUR BASIS BY REGISTERED NURSES, LICENSES PRACTICAL NURSES, NURSE AIDES, AND ATTENDING PHYSICIANS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THOMAS WETMORE, BOARD CHAIR IS RELATED TO KEITH GIBB, PRESIDENT. THEIR WIVES ARE SECOND COUSIN THROUGH MARRIAGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT AND THE DIRECTOR OF CORPORATE FINANCE BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUAL DISCLOSURES OF CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REQUIRED TO BE COMPLETED. ANY DIRECTOR WHO HAS AN INTEREST IN A CONTRACT OR OTHER TRANSACTION PRESENTATED TO THE BOARD OR A COMMITTEE THEREOF FOR AUTHORIZATION, APPROVAL, OR RATIFICATION SHALL MAKE A PROMPT AND FULL DISCLOSURE OF THEIR INTEREST TO THE BOARD OR COMITTEE PRIOR TO ITS ACTIN ON SUCH CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION. SUCH DISCLOSURE SHALL INCLUDE ANY RELEVANT AND MATERIAL FACTS KNOWN TO SUCH A PERSON ABOUT THE CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION THAT MIGHT REASONABLY BE CONSTRUED TO BE ADVERSE TO THE CORPORATION'S INTEREST. NO DIRECTOR SHALL CAST A VOTE ON ANY MATTER WHICH HAS A DIRECT BEARING ON SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED BY THAT DIRECTOR OR ANY ORGANIZATION WHICH SUCH DIRECTOR REPRESENTS OR IN WHICH SUCH DIRECTOR HAS AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST OR IS OTHERWISE INTERESTED OR AFFILIATED, WHICH WOULD DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY FINANCIALLY BENEFIT SUCH DIRECTOR. ALL SUCH SERVICES WILL BE FULLY DISCLOSED OR KNOWN TO THE BOARD MEMBERS PRESENT AT THE MEETING AT WHICH SUCH CONTRACT SHALL BE AUTHORIZED. CORPORATION SALARIED INDIVIDUALS CANNOT VOTE ON THEIR OWN COMPENSATION, AND COMPENSATION DECISIONS WILL BE MADE BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR AS OTHERWISE PROVIDED IN THESE THE BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION DETERMINATION INCLUDES REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE AT THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE

MANAGEMENT ASKS FOR THE FINANCE COMMITTEE'S PERMISSION TO DO A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL CONCERNING THE APPOINTMENT OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. ONCE GRANTED, MANAGEMENT WILL DO A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL AND MAKE A RECOMMENDATION BACK TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE BASED ON PRICE, VALUE, AND EXPERIENCE IN THE NOT-FOR-PROFIT POST-ACUTE ARENA. ONCE APPROVED, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE WILL MAKE A RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, WHO MAKES THE FINAL APPROVAL.
